author: Special Correspondent
text:
An awareness programme on ‘higher education opportunities in the United States’ was organised by the Higher Education Cell (Abroad), Department of Mechanical Engineering, Knowledge Institute of Technology here recently.

Vice-Consul, U.S. Consulate General, Chennai, Walid Zafar, who was the chief guest, spoke on the importance of creative learning and experimental learning system of education in the U.S. He said that about 9,000 different universities are available in the U.S. for higher education. Students have variety of choices with respect to their discipline.

He also emphasised the importance of Statement of Purpose (SOP) and how to prepare the SOP for a particular university.

At the interaction session that followed, Mr. Walid Zafar, clarified the doubts raised by the students on how to select the university with respect to their discipline for MS (by research) and requirement for the visa. P. S. S. Srinivasan, Principal, KIOT, presided over the programme and motivated the students to do higher education and about the job opportunities available in the U.S. after higher education.

He also explained about the practical learning culture in foreign countries.
title: Awareness drive about education in U.S.
